I discovered Thermodynamics principle is a half-truth. There are some proofs that the Law of Conservation of Energy is not always conserved and destroyed and not always constant.

Computation proves that the principle of Thermodynamics is not always conserved and destroyed and constant.

The applications of the explosion in the system of the principle of Thermodynamics.

Wikipedia meaning of explosion: An explosion is a rapid increase in volume and release of energy in an extreme manner.

Illustration 1
I. The mixture of compressed air and fuel on the piston of an engine is not enough to move the piston up and down. The explosions increase and created an energy of the cylinder causing the piston to move.
The petrol of 10Joule is not enough to move the car, the explosion increases and created energy causing the car to move.

Illustration 2
A 15 ball billiard pool to be strike by white mother ball.

F = 30lbs (White Mother Ball); D = 3ft (Distance from the white mother ball to the first ball to strike); W = Work, F = force; D = Distance

The mother ball to strike the 15 ball is the work input
The first collision is explosion followed by an increase in force and travelled distance by individual ball followed again a series of collisions.

The mother ball transferred the force to the group of 15ball. The momentum is conserved to the group of 15 while the explosion increases to 15 individual balls.

SOLVE FOR WORK INPUT
W = F X D; W = 30lbs x 3ft = 90Ft.lbs

SOLVE FOR WORK OUTPUT
W = F X D; W = 30lbs x 3ft = 90ft.lbs X 15ball = 1,350 ft-lbs.
It shows the Energy increase by 15times. The elastic momentum was conserved from one piece mother ball to the group of 15. However, the explosion after the collision increases the momentum into 15.

Illustration 3
For more heat energy the ball to replace with steel ball and steel sideboard. After strike is explosions of 15 balls. The explosion increases the group energy into individual 15. The work output higher than work input followed by a series of collisions that produces more heat more work output, more sound energy more work output, more travelling distance more work output.

Illustration 4
To get even more energy output without increasing the work input. Put an additional two groups of 6balls in a triangular shape to be placed somewhere at the back of 15balls at least 4inches apart from the sidewall and back wall. A total of 15balls + 6balls + 6balls = 21balls. The explosion creates collisions after collisions increasing the energy output.

After explosion the work done increased 21 times. That principle can use to make free energy machine.


The Law of Momentum states that the total momentum of two or more objects acting upon each other does not change, without external unbalance forces.

In this situation after the first collision is an explosion that increases the momentum from one body to multiple bodies



Thank you.

Hey quick question for those interested. How much do you need to cool a solar cell operating at, let's say, 23% efficiency?

My thoughts are that a solar cell should not change its internal energt U, so in other words deltaU or dU/dt should be 0. So 23% of the solar energy becomes electrical work, while the rest of the sun's power (1-0.23=0.77) becomes heat that accumulates in the solar cell.


In order for dU/dt (delta U) of the solar cell to be 0 you need to fulfill Q=W, so in other words you need to cool the cell to such an extent that the only heat that isn't cooled off equals the electrical power of the solar cell, in this case 0.54 times the power of the sun?

Is this way of thinking correct? I would very much appreciate any input.

Einstein's famous equation, E=mc^2 is wrong otherwise garbage also can be used to  make nuclear bombs as long as it is matter or it has mass. Energy and matter can't interchange one another according to Einstein's famous equation. One must have photons before one can emit out  photons. Photons are particles and they have mass. All forms of EMWs including heat and light are dynamic photons per volume per time in different saturations. The most important aspect in thermodynamic is heat. What is heat? Heat is dynamic photons per volume per time. High heat means high temperature due to high availability of dynamic photons within a system as a result of the presence of a heat emitter. In the contrary, low heat means low temperature due to low availability of photons within a system as a result of the  presence of a heat absorber. Currently temperature has been defined as the average kinetic of atoms within a system. Why and how high temperature leads to high kinetic energy have not been explained? Likewise why and how low temperature leads to low kinetic energy of atoms within a system have not been explained too? Without any doubt that photons is the missing link between temperature and average kinetic energy. Higher temperature means higher availability of photons will lead to higher kinetic energy of atoms within a system after they have stockpiled more stationary photons from a heat emitter. In the contrary, lower temperature means lower availability of photons will result to lower kinetic energy after atoms within a system dissipate more photons to the surrounding that absorbed by a heat absorber more than the one that they absorbed from the surroundings that subsequently leading them to have lower kinetic energy. Thermodynamic is all about heat (dynamic photons in particular). We should exam on how dynamic photons interact with atoms within a system that leads to work done rather than relying on some mathematical equation to explain thermodynamic phenomenon. I prefer the statistical explanation which you touched on, for entropy.  Order and disorder are very ambiguous terms and one can be confused for the other.  But if you think of it like bouncy balls in a container, you realize they will spread out, and the likelyhood of them being in any particular configuration is small.  Basically things become distributed.  A balanced coin given enough flips, will be near 50%, a 6 sided die will eventually have 1/6th chance for each number to be rolled.  A coin has less entropy than a 6 sided die, because there's more states a 6 sided die can take.  A molecule of air moving in a 2d plane has 360 degrees of freedom, all equally likely, so it's easy to see how in a 3d world with so much interacting the amount of entropy is insanely big.  One person's ordered chess board might be another person's mess, people can define order as simply a state they find desirable so ti's entirely too loose a term to truly understand why when you put a drop of color into a water bowl, the water bowl becomes evenly distributed in color over time.  Yet, one person might say that the system started out disorderly (non uniform) and became orderly (uniform distribution of color)  when in fact, this is exactly what entropy is, in action.  The molecules distributed evenly.  Heat does the same, and it's all driven by the same statistics as that flipping coin.  When you have a lot of ways to equally do something, and enough time/iterations, the average is represented.  Anyway that is the method I use to think of it as the order/disorder example always confused me.

Entropy is a matter of perspective. Look at  the biosphere. For three and half billion years life has been becoming steadily more orderly by the simple means of one organ ism consuming the high entropy of another and turning it into order. For example plants oxygen is high entropy for us it low entropy and in turn we convert oxygen into carbon dioxide. This is the positive exchange of entropy is fundamental to the biosphere. For three and half billion years, until humans invented technology that is. Technology always creates pockets of low entropy at the expense of spreading a greater amount high entropy, like your fridge. Its true socially as well, society creates pockets of wealth and acres of poverty. My question is this: if every other species can create more low entropy than high entropy, why can't scientists with advanced tech do the same? As for the universe goes,  my guess is that they one day find out that high entropy actually gets processed somehow and becomes low entropy again.

The way you  are introducing thermodynamics is a bit rushed. No wonder people run away from this subject. First introduced historical data, what led to the formation of the laws. Who were the characters, how are they related to other pioneers in other fields. What you are presenting is like writing code.

Forgive me for sounding nit-picky but,

Perhaps the 2nd Law would have been better explained with the description of Exergy and how it relates to Entropy:
The 2nd Law describes the quality of the energy being exchanged; that is energy must be conserved, but work may be destroyed in a non-perfect system.
In other words, its the Law of Conservation of Exergy/ Generated Entropy.

With all due respect,

This video made me think about entropy of information. What I mean by that is that basically there are some thoughts inside my head, not pretty much ordered, but still ordered enough for me to think about them and write a comment here. Now, these memes are there, but not ordered enought for me to come up with something profound, which would cause a paradigm shift in our knowledge and eventually the nobel prize (this is a jokre, ok?). But nevertheless, I "consume" some of the entropy of highly odered "minds" as I "disorder" my own (remeber we are talking about information entropy here). So by my nonsense comment here, which you are still reading, I rise the quality of the real "scientists" out there.   Yes, this post is a joke. Maybe you found it funny, maybe not, maybe you will not see it. :-)   OK Now I googled "information entropy" and even this "stupid" comment is by far nowhere near random. Interesting to know that information does not value itself by whether it is relevant or nor (or true or not). It just is an ordered piece of letters, but the meaning is up to us. The wording with "closed" and "isolated" at 01:58 isn't chosen well.
Isolated systems and closed systems are both defined and they're not the same. In a nutshell: Isolated systems do not have transfer of mass or energy with the outside while closed systems can exchange energy with the outside but not mass.
